description: The compound index is the native database index format used by Visual FoxPro. There are two types of CDX files: Structural CDX file - Automatically opened and maintained by Visual FoxPro when the table is accessed and requires exclusive use of the table. Non-structural CDX file - Not opened or maintained automatically by Visual FoxPro when the table is accessed and new records are added but does not require exclusive use of the table. NOTE: Visual FoxPro was discontinued in 2007.
NOTE: Visual FoxPro was discontinued in 2007.

common_filenames.description: [Name of your table].cdx - When a table is created and the index field is defined, the CDX file will be created with the same name as your table.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .cdx file in CS Odessa ConceptDraw DIAGRAM 16
images.caption: CDX file open in CS Odessa ConceptDraw DIAGRAM 16
